text.text: When you get into a fight and kick some ass, roll +Tough.

On a 7+, you and whatever you're fighting inflict harm on each other. The amount of harm is based on the esablished dangers in the game. That usually means you inflict the harm rating of your weapon and your enemy inflicts their attack's harm rating on you.
On a 10+, choose one extra effect:
list: You gain the advantage: take +1 forward, or give +1 forward to another hunter.
You inflict terrible harm (+1 harm).
You suffer less harm (-1 harm).
You force them where you want them.

text.text: When you act under pressure, roll +Cool.
On a 10+ you do what you set out to.
On a 7-9 the Keeper is going to give you a worse outcome, hard choice, or price to pay.
When you help another hunter, roll +Cool.
On a 10+ your help grant them +1 to their roll.
On a 7-9 your help grants them +1 to their roll, but you also expose yourself to trouble or danger.
When you investigate a mystery, roll +Sharp. On a 10+ hold 2, and on a 7-9 hold 1. One hold can be spent to ask the Keeper one of the following questions:
list: What happened here?
What sort of creature is it?
What can it do?
What can hurt it?
Where did it go?
What was it going to do?
What is being concealed here?

text.text: Once you have given them a reason, tell them what you want them to do and roll +Charm.
For a normal person:
list: On a 10+, then they'll do it for the reason you gave them. If you asked too much, they'll tell you the minimum it would take for them to do it (or if there's no way they'd do it.
On a 7-9, they'll do it, but only if you do something for them right now to show that you mean it. If you asked too much, they'll tell you what, if anything, it would take for them to do it.

text.text: For another hunter:
list: On a 10+, if they do what you ask they mark experience and get +1 forward.
On a 7-9, they mark experience if they do what you ask.
On a miss, it's up to that hunter to decide how badly you offend or annoy them. They mark experience if they decide not to do what you asked. Monsters and minions cannot normally be manipulated.

text.text: When you prevent harm to another character, roll +Tough.
On a 7+, you protect them okay but you'll suffer some or all of the harm they were going to get.
On a 10+ choose an extra:
list: You suffer little harm (-1 harm).
All impending danger is now focused on you.
You inflict harm on the enemy.
You hold the enemy back.

text.text: When you look around and read a bad situation, roll +Sharp.
On a 10+ hold 3, and on a 7-9, hold 1.
One hold can be spent to ask the Keeper one of the following questions:
list: What's my best way in?
What's my best way out?
Are there any dangers that we haven't noticed?
What's the biggest threat?
What's most vulnerable to me?
What's the best way to protect the victims?

text.text: If you act on the answers, you get +1 ongoing while the information is relevant.
When you use magic, say what you're trying to achieve and how you do the spell, then roll +Weird.
On a 10+, the magic works without issues: choose your effect.
On a 7-9, it works imperfectly: choose your effect and a glitch. The Keeper will decide what effect the glitch has.
Effects
list: Inflict harm (1-harm ignore-armor magic obvious
Enchant a weapon. It gets +1 harm and +magic.
Do one thing that is beyond human limitations.
Bar a place or portal to a specific person or a type of creature.
Trap a specific person, minion, or monster.
Banish a spirit or curse from the person, object, or place it inhabits.
Summon a monster into the world.
Communicate with something that you do not share a language with.
Observe another place or time.
Heal 1-harm from an injury, or cure a disease, or neutralize a poison.

text.text: Glitches
list: The effect is weakened.
The effect is of short duration.
You take 1-harm ignore-armor.
The magic draws immediate, unwelcome attention.
It has a problematic side effect.

text.text: The Keeper May Say That...
list: The spell requires weird materials.
The spell will take 10 seconds, 30 seconds, or 1 minute to cast.
The spell requires ritual chanting and gestures.
The spell requires you to draw arcane symbols.
You need one or two people to help cast the spell.
You need to refer to a tome of magic for the details.

text.text: When you open up your brain to feel the emotions of something right there in front of you, roll +Weird
list: On a 10 or more, you glain a clear impressino of theri current emotional state and intentions. Take +1 forward when acting on this knowledge.
On a 7-9, you gani a hazy impression of their current emotional state and intentions.
On a miss, your brain is overwhelmed with emotion.

text.text: YOu can use Empath on anything with emotions (e.g. animals and some monsters), but the less human they are, the less it's safe for you. If the emotions are especially strong or alien, you might need to act under pressure regardless of how successful your roll was.

You have become enlightened, and sometimes recieve information telepathically from the Secret Masters. The Secret Masters are the benevolent conspiracy fighting to make society (or the universe) perfect. At least, that's what they told you. Sometimes, at the Keeper's discretion, they proactively send you information, advice, or orders.
When you telepathically ask the Secret Masters for aid, roll +Weird:
list: On a 10+, the Secret Masters reveal a key fact, clue, or technique that will help you.
On a 7-9, the Secret Masters need you to complete a task for them. Once it is done, they reveal a key fact, clue, or technique that will help you.
On a miss, the Secret Masters' reply is terrible, garbled, or somehow dangerously wrong.
